headline: FAAC shares N590.546bn to FG, States and LGAs
summarized_story:
The Federation Accounts Allocation Committee (FAAC) has shared N590.546 billion February 2022 Federation Account Revenue to the Federal Government, States and Local Government Councils.
The N590.546 billion total distributable revenue comprised distributable statutory revenue of N337.432 billion; distributable Value Added Tax (VAT) revenue of N165.635 billion and Excess Bank Charges of N7.479 billion and Non-Mineral Revenue of N80.000 billion.
From this, the Federal Government received N165.248 billion, the State Governments received N83.816 billion and the Local Government Councils received N64.618 billion.
The sum of N5.123 billion allocation to NEDC and N7.115 billion cost of collection were deducted from the N177.873 billion gross Value Added Tax (VAT) revenue, resulting in the distributable Value Added Tax (VAT) revenue of N165.635 billion.
Import and Excise Duties, Companies Income Tax (CIT), and Value Added Tax (VAT) recorded considerable decrease.

headline: 2023: Niger Governor Directs Aides With Ambition To Resign
summarized_story:
Amid controversy on whether political appointees are to vacate their offices before contesting or not in primaries of the political parties, Niger State government has ordered political office holders aspiring to contest for elective political offices in 2023 to tender their resignation letter.
The government in a circular obtained by LEADERSHIP dated 21/3/2022 and signed by the secretary to the state government Ahmed Ibrahim Matane gave all political aspirants who are appointees up to the end of March to tender their resignation.

headline: FG, States, LGs share N695.033bn for Feb 2022

headline: [Breaking] Electoral Act: Senators divided, debates Court ruling Wednesday
summarized_story:
The Senate Tuesday resolved to debate ruling of a Federal High Court in Umuahia, Abia state last week which nullified provisions of section 84(12) of the 2022 Electoral Act.
Justice Evelyn Anyadike of the Federal High Court had in her ruling last week Friday, ordered the Attorney – General of the Federation to expunge the section from the Electoral Act.
She said the section contravenes provisions of the 1999 Constitution which allows appointive political office holders contesting for any election to remain in office 30 days to the election.
Need for debate on the court ruling was moved by Senator George Sekibo (PDP Rivers East) and seconded by Senator Chukwuka Utazi (PDP Enugu North).

headline: Russia-Ukraine War: Civilians Fleeing Mariupol Describe Street-to-Street Battles
summarized_story:
Civilians making the dangerous escape from Ukraine’s embattled southern port hub of Mariupol described fleeing through street-to-street gun battles and past unburied corpses as a steady Russian bombardment tried to pound the city into submission.
The regained territory allowed Ukrainian forces to retake control of a key highway to the west and block Russian troops from surrounding Kyiv from the northwest.
Russian President Vladimir Putin’s forces are increasingly concentrating their air power and artillery on Ukraine’s cities and the civilians living there, killing uncounted numbers and sending millions fleeing.
Olga Nikitina, who fled Mariupol for the western Ukrainian city of Lviv, where she arrived Sunday, said gunfire blew out her windows, and her apartment dropped below freezing.
Talks between Russia and Ukraine have continued by video but failed to bridge the chasm between the two sides.
